content.introduction: Understanding the number system, place value, and working with large numbers up to crores.

topics.title: Comparing Numbers
topics.description: Learning to compare and order numbers from smallest to largest or vice versa.

topics.title: Large Numbers - Indian System
topics.description: Understanding crores, lakhs, thousands in the Indian numbering system.
examples: Example: 2,34,56,789 = Two crore thirty-four lakh fifty-six thousand seven hundred eighty-nine

topics.title: Large Numbers - International System
topics.description: Understanding millions and billions in the international numbering system.
examples: Example: 12,345,678 = Twelve million three hundred forty-five thousand six hundred seventy-eight

exercises: Write in words: 5,34,67,890
Arrange in descending order: 8,76,543; 8,67,543; 8,76,453
Convert 1 crore to millions
Insert commas according to Indian system: 567890123
Find the difference between the largest and smallest 6-digit number

content.introduction: Understanding whole numbers, their properties, and operations on the number line.

topics.title: Properties of Whole Numbers
topics.description: Learning commutative, associative, and distributive properties.

exercises: Find the sum using properties: 567 + 498 + 433
Find next three numbers: 15, 30, 45, ___, ___, ___
Is subtraction commutative? Give examples
The product of successor of 99 and predecessor of 101

content.introduction: Learning about different nutrients in food, their sources, and the importance of a balanced diet.

topics.title: Nutrients in Food
topics.description: Understanding the six main nutrients: carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water.
examples: Proteins - pulses, eggs, meat (for growth and repair)
Minerals - milk, green vegetables (for bones and blood)
Water - essential for all body functions

topics.title: Balanced Diet
topics.description: A diet containing all nutrients in the right proportion.
examples: Include all food groups in meals
Eat variety of fruits and vegetables

topics.title: Deficiency Diseases
topics.description: Diseases caused by lack of specific nutrients.

exercises: Name two sources each of proteins and carbohydrates
What is a balanced diet? Why is it important?
Match nutrients with their deficiency diseases
Plan a balanced meal for your lunch
Why do we need vitamins and minerals?

content.introduction: A story about two baby birds separated during a storm, showing how environment shapes character.

topics.title: Theme and Moral
topics.description: Understanding the message that company matters and environment influences behavior.
examples: One bird lived with robbers - became rude
Other bird lived with sages - became polite

exercises: Why did the two birds behave differently?
What is the moral of the story?
Write the story in your own words
Answer comprehension questions

chapters.title: The Earth in the Solar System

content.introduction: Understanding our solar system, planets, stars, and Earth's place in the universe.

topics.title: The Solar System
topics.description: The Sun and all celestial bodies that revolve around it.
examples: 8 planets: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune
Sun is a star - provides heat and light

topics.title: Planet Earth
topics.description: Why Earth is called the Blue Planet and conditions for life.
examples: Has air, water, and suitable temperature

exercises: Name all the planets in order from the Sun
Why is Earth called the Blue Planet?
What makes Earth suitable for life?
Draw and label the solar system
